TNG.summary: Captain Picard, Data and Dr. Crusher are trapped in a holodeck program as 1940's detectives during a holdeck malfunction that interferes with a meeting with a alien species that requires the captain only.

TNG.name: Datalore
TNG.summary: The Enterprise explores Data's home planet, Omicron Theta. They find his brother, and the dark secret he carries.

TNG.name: Angel One
TNG.summary: An Enterprise away team beams down to a planet with a matriarchal society to search for survivors of a crashed Federation freighter.

At a Federation space station aliens known as the Binars come aboard to upgrade the Enterprises computer and Holographic systems. During this process, the Enterprise is hijacked while Captain Picard and Riker are in the Holodeck.

TNG.name: Too Short a Season
TNG.summary: A diplomat is requested to mediate a hostage situation and the leader of the world wants the same diplomat that negotiated more than 40 years before. The Admiral who did the negotiations in the past comes on board and starts acting more strangely as time passes.

TNG.name: When the Bough Breaks
TNG.summary: Inhabitants of an advanced planet, who can no longer reproduce, plan to kidnap children from the Enterprise to rebuild their race.

TNG.name: Home Soil
TNG.summary: On Velara III, Data and Geordi discover a microscopic creature responsible for the death of an engineer.

TNG.name: Coming of Age
TNG.summary: Wesley is put to the test as he competes with the other top candidates to get into the star fleet academy. Meanwhile the enterprise is put under the scrutiny of a star fleet officer that seems to be looking for trouble.

TNG.name: Heart of Glory
TNG.summary: The Enterprise rescues the crew of a damaged vessel in the Neutral zone, discovering several renegade Klingons who decide that they want Lt. Worf to join them.

TNG.name: The Arsenal of Freedom
TNG.summary: While investigating the disappearance of the star ship Drake, an away team beams down to a strange planet where they received a message about arms sales upon arriving in orbit. Captain Picard and Dr. Crusher vanish during the mission and the Enterprise comes under attack.

TNG.name: Symbiosis
TNG.summary: When the Enterprise rescues a freighter with engine problems and is being drawn into a planets gravitational field, Picard gets more than he bargained for when it is discovered that the one planets inhabitants may be carrying a disease. The disease causes Picard to consider the Federation's Prime Directive and why it is necessary.

TNG.name: Skin of Evil
TNG.summary: Deanna is held hostage by a black oil-like alien creature capable of infinite sadism… and infinite power. To save her, one of the Enterprise crew will die.

TNG.name: We'll Always Have Paris
TNG.summary: Captain Picard reflects on a missed liason at a Paris cafe years in his past when the Enterprise gets a distress call from a scientist who is experimenting with Time rifts and is married to the lady he was supposed to meet in Paris all those years ago.

TNG.name: Conspiracy
TNG.summary: Spurred by reports of misdeeds in Starfleet's top echelon, Captain Picard heads for Earth to uncover the truth.

TNG.name: The Neutral Zone
TNG.summary: The Enterprise encounters a ancient capsule containing cryogenically frozen people from 20th Century Earth. Data then brings them on board while the Enterprise is on its way to investigate a series of destroyed Federation outposts at the edge of the Romulan/Federation Neutral zone. The Enterprise soon encounters a Romulan Warbird after the Romulans presence being long absent.

TNG.name: The Child
TNG.summary: Counselor Deanna Troi announces she is pregnant; the crew sets out to bring a deadly plasma plague to a laboratory.

TNG.name: Where Silence Has Lease
TNG.summary: A being conducting an experiment traps the Enterprise in a region void of energy and matter.

TNG.name: Elementary, Dear Data
TNG.summary: Data dons a deerstalker to solve a Sherlock Homes mystery in a holodeck recreation of Victorian London.

TNG.name: The Outrageous Okona
TNG.summary: A roguish space captain charms all; Data consults a comic about humor.

TNG.name: Loud as a Whisper
TNG.summary: A deaf mediator's mission to a warring planet is jeopardized when his chorus of interpreters is killed.

TNG.name: The Schizoid Man
TNG.summary: A brilliant, dying scientist who seeks immortality transfers his mind and knowledge into Data.

TNG.name: Unnatural Selection
TNG.summary: After discovering a unresponsive federation starship, Dr. Pulaski contracts a disease and starts to age.

TNG.name: A Matter of Honor
TNG.summary: Commander Riker swaps positions and becomes a temporary first officer on the Klingon ship the Pah. A new crew member of the Enterprise scans the Pagh and discovers a micro lifeform growing on the hull of the ship.

TNG.name: The Measure of a Man
TNG.summary: Commander Maddox, the scientist who worked with Data after Doctor Soon when he first started functioning wants to dismantle Data in order to create more androids. Data makes a decision to resign from Starfleet to stop the process and Captain Picard ends up in a court battle to decide if Data is a lifeform or owned property.

TNG.name: The Dauphin
TNG.summary: When the Enterprise transports a future leader to another world, a guardian stands between Wesley and a potential love interest.

TNG.name: Contagion
TNG.summary: When coming to the aid of another Federation ship that is having problems in the Romulan neutral zone, the Enterprise starts having computer problems that leave the ship helpless. Picard believes that the problems may have something to do with a extinct alien race called the Iconians.

TNG.name: The Royale
TNG.summary: Riker, Worf and Data are trapped in the Hotel Royale and are unable to find their way out.

TNG.name: Time Squared
TNG.summary: The Enterprise picks up a Star Fleet shuttle floating in space and much to the crew's surprise, another Captain Picard is on board the shuttle. They then learn that the Enterprise is destroyed in a upcoming disaster.

TNG.name: The Icarus Factor
TNG.summary: Riker is offered a possible command of his own and in the process encounters his estranged father who brings him the news. Lt. Worf starts having emotional issues and Wesley digs into Klingon traditions to discover the cause.

TNG.name: Pen Pals
TNG.summary: Data makes contact with a alien girl and pen pals with her. He then discovers that her planet is in danger fand she could be killed.

TNG.name: Q Who?
TNG.summary: After Picard refuses to let Q join the crew, Q hurls the Enterprise into a far quadrant of space where they have a encounter with a unknown cybernetic race. A little bit of Guinan's past is revealed when she senses something is wrong on board Enterprise.

TNG.name: Samaritan Snare
TNG.summary: Geordi's life is jeopardized when an alien race kidnaps him; Picard is near death with heart complications.

TNG.name: Up the Long Ladder
TNG.summary: The Enterprise crew encounters a SOS from a lost colony ship and encounters a group of primitive colonists and after assisting them, they encounter the remaining colonists that traveled with them on another world with a unique problem of their own.

TNG.name: Manhunt
TNG.summary: On her way to a conference, Troi's mother boards the Enterprise and flirts with Picard; guest Mick Fleetwood.

TNG.name: The Emissary
TNG.summary: Worf's old love, a human-Klingon hybrid, arrives to deal with a shipload of Klingons in cryogenic sleep.

TNG.name: Peak Performance
TNG.summary: The Ferengi ambush the Enterprise and another vessel during a battle simulation.

TNG.name: The Ensigns of Command
TNG.summary: When a alien race demands that a lost human colony is to be evacuated, Data is sent to deal with the issue and has problems convincing the leader of the colony to abandon their homes.

TNG.name: The Survivors
TNG.summary: Captain Picard and the crew visit a isolate planet that is the home to two people who lived through a devastating attack. Picard then begins to suspect that all is not as it seems when the Enterprise is repeatedly attacked by a unknown ship.

TNG.name: Who Watches the Watchers?
TNG.summary: When a secret Federation observation post is accidentally revealed, a primitive culture ends up worshiping Picard as a god and prepares to sacrifice Troi to appease him.

TNG.name: The Bonding
TNG.summary: Worf takes responsibility for a boy when his mother, the ships archaeologist is killed on a away mission.

TNG.name: Booby Trap
TNG.summary: The Enterprise experiences a rapid energy drain that leaves the crew vulnerable to radiation exposure while exploring in a area of space where a alien race once lived.

TNG.name: The Enemy
TNG.summary: A Romulan warship thwarts attempts to rescue Geordi, stranded on a planet swept by electrical storms.

TNG.name: The Price
TNG.summary: Troi falls for a handsome delegate who uses underhanded tactics in negotiations.

TNG.name: The Vengeance Factor
TNG.summary: Picard offers to mediate a dispute between a peaceful society and a renegade clan that steals to live.

TNG.name: The Defector
TNG.summary: A Romulan defector leads the Enterprise into a confrontation that could erupt into war.

TNG.name: The Hunted
TNG.summary: A prison escapee claims he is a soldier brainwashed by his goverment to kill.

TNG.name: The High Ground
TNG.summary: A radical takes Dr. Crusher hostage to treat his injured Comrades.

TNG.name: Déjà Q
TNG.summary: Picard's nemesis Q, claiming to have lost his powers, appears on the Enterprise.

TNG.name: A Matter of Perspective
TNG.summary: A widow accuses Riker of seducing her and killing her husband, a respected scientist.

TNG.name: Yesterday's Enterprise
TNG.summary: An Enterprise from the past breaks through a time rift, altering the course of history.

TNG.name: The Offspring
TNG.summary: An admiral (Nicolas Coster) wants to remove Data's creation, a female android, from the Enterprise.

TNG.name: Sins of the Father
TNG.summary: Lt. Worf and his brother Kurn defend their family honor when the Klingon high council accuses their late father of treason.

TNG.name: Sarek
TNG.summary: Vulcan ambassador Sarek becomes temperamental while on the Enterprise with his wife.

TNG.name: Ménage à Troi
TNG.summary: The Ferengi kidnap Riker, Troi and her visiting mother.

TNG.name: Transfigurations
TNG.summary: The Enterprise crew saves a badly injured humanoid who possesses remarkable powers.

TNG.name: The Best of Both Worlds (1)
TNG.summary: The Borg advance their plans to assimilate the human race by kidnapping Picard and making him into their spokesman.

TNG.name: The Best of Both Worlds (2)
TNG.summary: Riker is torn between saving Picard or humanity when the Borg plan to use the abducted captain in their scheme to destroy Earth and turn him into Lucutus.

TNG.name: Suddenly Human
TNG.summary: Picard faces a child-custody dilemma after the Enterprise rescues an orphaned human child.

TNG.name: Remember Me
TNG.summary: When Doctor Crusher leaps into another dimension of reality, Enterprise crew members mysteriously disappear.

TNG.name: Legacy
TNG.summary: Tasha Yar's sister helps the Enterprise rescue Federation members held hostage on her planet.

TNG.name: Reunion
TNG.summary: Worf deals with a personal dilemma, Picard mediates a power struggle between successors to the Klingon Empire.

TNG.name: Final Mission
TNG.summary: Wesley goes on one last mission with Captain Picard that jeopardizes the Captains life before going to Starfleet academy.

TNG.name: Identity Crisis
TNG.summary: Geordi begins to exhibit signs of mutating into another life form as a result of a parasite picked up on an Away Team mission.

TNG.name: The Nth Degree
TNG.summary: An alien probe threatens the Enterprise when it emits an energy surge that turns an innocuous crew member into a superhuman.

TNG.name: The Mind's Eye
TNG.summary: The Romulans brainwash Geordi as part of a plot to drive a wedge between the Federation and the Klingon Empire.

TNG.name: In Theory
TNG.summary: While the Enterprise explores a nebula with unusual properties, Data becomes involved with a crew member.

TNG.name: Redemption (1)
TNG.summary: Part 1 of 2. Picard tries to keep the Federation neutral when the Klingon Empire faces civil war; Lt. Worf struggles with divided loyalties.

TNG.name: Redemption (2)
TNG.summary: Part 2 of 2: Suspecting Romulan interference, Picard gets involved in the Klingon civil war.

TNG.name: Darmok
TNG.summary: Picard encounters the leader of a civilization which communicates only in metaphor.

TNG.name: Ensign Ro
TNG.summary: A Starfleet admiral, unwittingly being used by outside forces, involves the Enterprise crew in a deadly conspiracy.

TNG.name: Silicon Avatar
TNG.summary: When the Crystalline Entitiy reappears, Picard and Data try to establish communication with it before it is destroyed by a vengeful scientist.

TNG.name: Disaster
TNG.summary: A natural force damages the Enterprise, trapping Picard and forcing Troi to act as captain.

TNG.name: The Game
TNG.summary: The Enterprise gets a surprise visit from Starfleet Academy Cadet Wesley Crusher, who discovers something alien and sinister controlling the crew.

TNG.name: Unification (1)
TNG.summary: Picard and Data follow Spock on an unauthorized mission to Romulus.

TNG.name: Unification (2)
TNG.summary: Spock proceeds with his quest for the reunification of Vulcan and Romulans even though he and Picard are suspicious of Romulan motives.

TNG.name: A Matter of Time
TNG.summary: As the Enterprise crew struggles to save Panthers IV following an asteroid collision, a historian from the 26th century arrives on board.

TNG.name: New Ground
TNG.summary: When Worf's mother tells him that his son's Earth parents can no longer care for him, Worf tries to be a father to his child, Alexander.

TNG.name: Hero Worship
TNG.summary: When a Starfleet ship crashes inside a thick, black cloud, Data attempts to coax the traumatised young sole survivor into revealing what exactly happened.

TNG.name: Violations
TNG.summary: Several crew members suffer violent hallucinations and comas as alien researchers visit the ship.

TNG.name: The Masterpiece Society
TNG.summary: The Enterprise tries to save a "perfect" colony from destruction, but the assistance causes damage of its own.

TNG.name: Conundrum
TNG.summary: When an alien ship crosses the Enterprise's path, its strong scanners cause all of the crew members to completely lose their memories

TNG.name: Power Play
TNG.summary: The Enterprise crew discovers a Federation starship missing for 200 years. However, Troi, O'Brien and Data find themselves haunted by demons on board.

TNG.name: Ethics
TNG.summary: When he loses the ability to walk after an accident in the Cargo bay, a traumatised Worf asks Riker to assist him in a Klingon suicide ritual.

TNG.name: The Outcast
TNG.summary: Riker finds himself falling for a Gennai when the two races collaborate on a mission to investigate the mysterious disappearance of a shuttle.

TNG.name: Cause and Effect
TNG.summary: The future of the Enterprise looks bleak when the ship gets trapped in a time warp, causing the crew members to continually repeat their experience.

TNG.name: The First Duty
TNG.summary: When Wesley Crusher's team suffers an accident at Starfleet Academy, Picard helps investigate its cause, and believes a cover-up is taking place.

TNG.name: Cost of Living
TNG.summary: As the ship encounters mechanical problems, Lwaxana Troi takes Worf's son under her wing while she prepares for her wedding.

TNG.name: The Perfect Mate
TNG.summary: Picard finds himself attracted to a beautiful woman being given as a gift to promote reconciliation between two warring systems.

TNG.name: Imaginary Friend
TNG.summary: While exploring a rare nebula around a neutron star, the Enterprise's safety is threatened by a little girl's imaginary playmate.

TNG.name: I, Borg
TNG.summary: An encounter with a injured adolescent Borg gives Picard the opportunity to remove the Borg threat forever.

TNG.name: The Next Phase
TNG.summary: Geordi and Ro disappear and are presumed dead after a transporting maneuver from a disabled Romulan science ship goes awry.

TNG.name: The Inner Light
TNG.summary: Picard awakens after being hit by a mysterious particle stream from a type of probe/satellite the ship discovered, to find he is living another life on a strange planet.

TNG.name: Time's Arrow (1)
TNG.summary: Data is transported back in time to 19th century San Francisco, where he hopes to solve the mystery of his death after a Enterprise away team finds Data's head buried in a cave.

TNG.name: Time's Arrow (2)
TNG.summary: The away team after encountering Mark Twain and Guinan in the 19th century, try to solve the mystery of who and what alien is killing people in 19th century San Francisco.

TNG.name: Realm of Fear
TNG.summary: A skittish member of Geordi's engineering staff encounters a bizarre creature while in the process of transporting from another ship.

TNG.name: Man of the People
TNG.summary: A visiting ambassador conceals the deadly secret to his successful negotiations as he attempts to use Troi to further is reputation.

TNG.name: Relics
TNG.summary: The Enterprise discovers a Dyson Sphere, in the process they discover a disabled ship that still has a crew member on board. When beaming over to the ship, Jordi discovers Montgomery "Scottie" Scott in the transporter system of the ship.

TNG.name: Schisms
TNG.summary: Adjustments to the subspace sensor array inadvertently establish a link to aliens who begin kidnapping crew members for experiments.

TNG.name: True Q
TNG.summary: A young honor student serving aboard the Enterprise is torn between remaining a part of the crew or accepting an offer made by Q.

TNG.name: Rascals
TNG.summary: Picard, Guinan, Ro and Keiko experience trouble aboard their shuttlecraft and transport back to the Enterprise...as 12 year old children.

TNG.name: A Fistful of Datas
TNG.summary: After a computer malfunction,Worf, his son Alexander Rozhenko, and Counselor Deanna Troi are trapped in an Old West holodeck program wherein the interactive characters physically resemble and have the same enhanced abilities as Data.

TNG.name: The Quality of Life
TNG.summary: Data discovers a group of robots that he believes qualify as lifeforms.

TNG.name: Chain of Command (1)
TNG.summary: Picard, Worf, and Dr. Crusher are reassigned from theEnterpriseto a secret mission. Meanwhile, theEnterpriseis under the command of Captain Edward Jellico, who immediately starts making changes, much to the dismay of the crew.

TNG.name: Chain of Command (2)
TNG.summary: Captain Picard's secret mission fails, leading to him being captured by Cardassians. As he is tortured by his captors, Captain Jellico and theEnterpriseattempt to prevent war with the Cardassian Union.

TNG.name: Ship in a Bottle
TNG.summary: Data is playing Sherlock Holmes on the Holodeck, a glitch appears and Lt. Barclay is called to investigate and he discovers protected Holodeck files. Professor Moriarty is then released and demands to see Captain Picard. Against the laws of physics, Moriarty is able to leave the Holodeck and takes control of the Enterprise.

TNG.name: Aquiel
TNG.summary: A Starfleet Lieutenant and a Klingon officer is implicated in the murder of the missing starfleet officer on a remote relay station. One of the shuttlecraft's is missing as well. Aquiel Uhnari is befriended by Geordi after he reads her personal logs during the investigation.

TNG.name: Face of the Enemy
TNG.summary: Troi wakes up as a Romulan intelligence officer much to her surprise. She then finds out that it is part of a elaborate scheme for Romulan dissident's to defect.

TNG.name: Tapestry
TNG.summary: Picard is near death and Q makes him relive a tragedy from his Starfleet Academy days.

TNG.name: Birthright (1)
TNG.summary: Data is zapped by a energy stream and has strange memories from during the time he was out. Worf hears a story that his father may not have died on Khitomer but may still be alive on a planet near the Romulan neutral zone.

TNG.name: Birthright (2)
TNG.summary: Data explores the experience he had while zapped, Worf is held prisoner by Romulans with the Khitomer survivors.

TNG.name: Starship Mine
TNG.summary: Captain Picard and a desperate gang of thieves are trapped on board the Enterprise while the ship is being swept with deadly baryon rays to remove radiation the ship has absorbed over time.

TNG.name: Lessons
TNG.summary: Picard becomes intrigued and then involved with a brilliant new crew member, creating complications when a potentially deadly mission arises.

TNG.name: The Chase
TNG.summary: The death of Picards archaeology professor results in a tantalizing mystery involving Klingons, Cardassians and Romulans.

TNG.name: Frame of Mind
TNG.summary: On a secret mission to a troubled planet, Riker questions his mental stability after experiencing a series of confusing vignettes.

TNG.name: Suspicions
TNG.summary: The death of a pioneering Ferengi scientist ebroils Dr. Crusher in a mystery that may end her Starfleet career.

TNG.name: Rightful Heir
TNG.summary: Warrior Kahless returns from death to reclaim the Klingon empire.

TNG.name: Second Chances
TNG.summary: Riker returns to the site of a 8-year old mission, to retrieve important research data and is unnerved to encounter his identical twin.

TNG.name: Timescape
TNG.summary: When returning to the Enterprise, Picard, Data, Troi and Geordi find that the Enterpise is frozen in time with a Romulan ship and in the middle of a core breach.

TNG.name: Descent (1)
TNG.summary: Data experiences anger for the first time when Borg attack the Enterprise, Picard then try's to track the Borg down while Data attempts to recreate the emotion.

TNG.name: Descent (2)
TNG.summary: Imprisoned by the Borg and cut off from his ship, Picard, Troi and LaForge attempt to break Lore's hold on Data. Meanwhile, Dr. Crusher tries to beam up all the search parties on the planet while eluding a Borg ship.

TNG.name: Liaisons
TNG.summary: A cultural exchange teams Worf with an obnoxious ambassador and strands Picard with a woman who seems to be obsessed with him.

TNG.name: Interface
TNG.summary: In defiance of Picard's orders, Geordi uses a risky procedure in an effort to find and save his missing mother.

TNG.name: Gambit (1)
TNG.summary: Captain Picard infiltrates a smuggling ring that is searching for Romulan artifacts.

TNG.name: Gambit (2)
TNG.summary: Captain Picard and commander Riker pose as enemies in order to retrieve a deadly artifact.

TNG.name: Phantasms
TNG.summary: The crew helps Data investigate when his dream program begins suddenly generating nightmares. Meanwhile, Picard attempts to avoid attending a boring Starfleet banquet.

TNG.name: Dark Page
TNG.summary: Lwaxana Troi visits the Enterprise, but she's preoccupied by a dark secret she has carried for years.

TNG.name: Attached
TNG.summary: After escaping imprisonment on an alien world, Picard and Beverly find that their thoughts are connected by brain implants.

TNG.name: Force of Nature
TNG.summary: The crew is shocked when an alien brother and sister sneak on board and claim their planet is being destroyed by the Enterprise's warp drive.

TNG.name: Inheritance
TNG.summary: During a mission to save an endangered planet, Data is stunned when he meets a native scientist who claims to be his estranged mother.

TNG.name: Parallels
TNG.summary: After Worf returns from a bat'leth tournament, he is the only person who notices subtle changes on theEnterprise.

TNG.name: The Pegasus
TNG.summary: Riker's loyalties are tested when he is reunited with his former captain, Pressman, now Admiral, of the missing ship Pegasus.

TNG.name: Homeward
TNG.summary: Worf's brother violates the Prime Directive in order to save an alien race whose existence is threatened when violent storms bombard their planet.

TNG.name: Sub Rosa
TNG.summary: Dr Crusher is shocked to come across a family secret when she attends her grandmothers funeral.

TNG.name: Lower Decks
TNG.summary: Four young officers become embroiled in a secret - and potentially dangerous - mission as they vie for promotion.

TNG.name: Thine Own Self
TNG.summary: Data trails a probe which has crashed on to a primitive planet. But when he crashes too, he finds himself unable to remember anything prior to the event.

TNG.name: Masks
TNG.summary: Picard discovers that an 87-million-years-old comet has been housing alien beings, which attack both Data and the Enterprise' computer systems.

TNG.name: Eye of the Beholder
TNG.summary: A suicide on the Enterprise leaves the crew stunned by the loss. Meanwhile, Deanna and Worf begin to form a relationship.

TNG.name: Genesis
TNG.summary: Picard and Data brave going into an asteroid field when a new torpedo's guidance system malfunctions. Meanwhile, the crew begin to act strangely.

TNG.name: Journey's End
TNG.summary: When the Federation gives the Cardassians access to a planet inhabited by Native American Indians, Picard has the unenviable task of trying to relocate them.

TNG.name: Firstborn
TNG.summary: Alexander must face his first rite of ascension initiation, during which a Klingon warrior named K'Mtar has a disturbing request for him.

TNG.name: Bloodlines
TNG.summary: Captain Picard battles to rescue his son from a vengeful Ferengi whose own son was killed by Picard during the Battle of Maxia.

TNG.name: Emergence
TNG.summary: The computer systems on board the Enterprise begin experiencing repeated malfunctions, leading the crew to suspect that the ship itself may be evolving.

TNG.name: Preemptive Strike
TNG.summary: When Ro is assigned to infiltrate the Maquis, she finds herself sympathising with their plight, forcing her to choose between her divided loyalties.

TNG.name: All Good Things... (1)
TNG.summary: Captain Picard finds himself travelling between the past, present and future, but discovers he may be responsible for the end of mankind.

TNG.name: All Good Things... (2)
TNG.summary: In the second of the two-part series finale, Picard continues his race against time to try and end the threat to the future of mankind.

VOY.name: Caretaker, Part I
VOY.summary: While searching for a missing officer, Captain Kathryn Janeway and the crew of the Starship Voyager are swept 70,000 light years from home.

VOY.name: Caretaker, Part II
VOY.summary: While searching for a missing officer, Captain Kathryn Janeway and the crew of the Starship Voyager are swept 70,000 light years from home.

VOY.name: Parallax
VOY.summary: Tensions rise between the merged Starfleet and Maquis crews when the ship becomes trapped inside a star that's collapsed upon itself.

VOY.name: Time and Again
VOY.summary: The Voyager crew discovers a world that has been destroyed by a type of energy that has been banned on all Federation worlds as being too dangerous to use.

VOY.name: Phage
VOY.summary: While seeking a source of new dylithium for the ships power source, the crew encounters a planet of people who are stealing body organs. Nelix finds another use for Captain Janeway's private dining room.

VOY.name: The Cloud
VOY.summary: Voyager enters a nebula only to discover it is not what they think it is. They then have to repair the damage they made upon entering.

VOY.name: Eye of the Needle
VOY.summary: Harry Kim discovers a small wormhole which raises the crew of Voyager's hopes of getting back home to the Alpha Quadrant.

VOY.name: Ex Post Facto
VOY.summary: Lt. Paris is found guilty of a brutal murder by a society that uses brain engrams as evidence and Tuvoc sets out to prove him innocent.

VOY.name: Emanations
VOY.summary: While searching for usable elements, Voyager discovers a vast cavern that has dead cocooned bodies in it. Ensign Kim is then accidentally transported to the home planet of the Uhnori who have been using the cavern as a burial ground.

VOY.name: Prime Factors
VOY.summary: Voyager encounters a planet of very friendly aliens who have the technology that could possibly get them home.

VOY.name: State of Flux
VOY.summary: The crew fears there may be a traitor on board the ship when they answer a Kazon ships emergency signal and discover Federation technology on board the ship.

VOY.name: Heroes and Demons
VOY.summary: Crew members start disappearing in the Holodeck and it is discovered that all control of the holodeck has been lost. The Doctor is then sent in to fight the mythical Grendal and discovers alien lifeforms.

VOY.name: Cathexis
VOY.summary: Gravely injured Chakotay tries to help the crew when aliens attempt to take over Voyager near a nebula.

VOY.name: Faces
VOY.summary: Lt. Torres is divided into two beings after being kidnapped by a Vidiian scientist who believes that her Klingon genetic inheritance may be able to cure the phage that affects the Vidiian race.

VOY.name: Jetrel
VOY.summary: The Haakonian scientist responsible for the device that destroyed a large number of Nelix's people, boards Voyager with claims that he is trying to help instead of cause harm.

VOY.name: Learning Curve
VOY.summary: One trainer, four trainees, and a confined training area to cook up some esprit de corps. Recipe for a good melting pot? Torres and the Doctor try to discover the source of Voyager's increasing power drains.

VOY.name: The 37's
VOY.summary: The crew of Voyager discovers a unusual object floating in space while following a particle trail. They then land on a planet and discover an old earth aircraft and then are led to a cave that contains cryogenic units with Earth people in it.

VOY.name: Initiations
VOY.summary: When Chakotay's shuttlecraft unknowingly runs through Kazon territory, Chakotay becomes the target of a young Kazon boy trying to earn his warrior name.

VOY.name: Projections
VOY.summary: The ships holographic doctor has a strange encounter with Lt. Barclay that leads him into having a problem telling reality from fiction. He is lead to believe that Voyager is nothing but a holographic simulation that he must fix.

VOY.name: Elogium
VOY.summary: When Voyager's crew encounters swarm of strange alien life forms in space, the aliens start forming what seems to be a attachment to Voyager. Meanwhile the encounter seems to accelerate Kes's reproductive cycle that comes only once in her species lifetime.

VOY.name: Non Sequitur
VOY.summary: Ensign Kim awakens on Earth in 24th century San Francisco, Star Fleet has no record of him ever having been a crew member on Voyager.

VOY.name: Twisted
VOY.summary: While giving a party for Kes the crew starts encountering a spatial distortion phenomenon. It gradually starts occurring inside the ship, changing Voyagers structural layout.

VOY.name: Parturition
VOY.summary: During a shuttle mission to replenish Voyager's food supplies, Neelix and Lt. Paris discover an embryonic pod and become caretakers of the hatchling infant.

VOY.name: Persistence of Vision
VOY.summary: A strange force causes the crew to enter a delusional state in which their most buried thoughts come to the surface.

VOY.name: Tattoo
VOY.summary: The away team Chakotay is on reminds him of when he was a youth and he disappointed his father by not embracing his tribes cultural heritage.

VOY.name: Cold Fire
VOY.summary: After Voyager encounters people of Kes's race, the Ocompa living on a space station, they lead the crew to the female mate of the caretaker who believes they caused the Caretakers death.

VOY.name: Maneuvers
VOY.summary: Chakotay feels responsible after Seska masterminds a successful raid on the Voyager that gives the Kazons vital Federation technology.

VOY.name: Resistance
VOY.summary: Janeway is forced to rely on her own devices when Torres and Tuvok are captured by the Mokra during a away mission that is searching for Tellerium. She is then assisted by a man who thinks she is his daughter.

VOY.name: Prototype
VOY.summary: Lt. Torres and Ensign Kim help a humanoid robot that is discovered by Voyager. Torres is then kidnapped by the robot who's fellow robots threaten to destroy Voyager unless Torres helps the robots by building a prototype robot.

VOY.name: Alliances
VOY.summary: Captain Janeway reluctantly tries to form an alliance with the Kazons and their longtime enemys in order to strengthen Voyager's position in the quadrant.

VOY.name: Threshold
VOY.summary: Paris experiments with breaking the warp 10 barrier, once transwarp is achieved Lt. Paris starts to undergo a strange transformation which places his life in danger.

VOY.name: Meld
VOY.summary: After a crewman is murdered, Tuvok decides to try and understand what drives a person to commit the violent impulses that causes a person to commit crimes. He uses a mind meld on the killer and starts to have violent tendencies.

VOY.name: Dreadnought
VOY.summary: Voyager has a encounter with a advanced self aware Cardassian missile that was also drawn into the Delta quadrant. The missile, believing it is still in the Alpha quadrant is on course to destroy a inhabited world. Torres must stop the missile before it reaches it's objective.

VOY.name: Death Wish
VOY.summary: While taking a sample of a strange space phenomenon Voyager brings a Q aboard. This in turn causes the Q who Riker and Picard are familiar with to come on board demanding that the Q Voyager discovered come back to the Q Continuum with him.

VOY.name: Lifesigns
VOY.summary: Voyager rescues a dying Viidian and during the process of trying to save her life, the Doctor's adaptive program allows him to experience romantic feelings for the first time. Lt. Paris starts objecting to his treatment on Voyager and ends up assaulting Chakotay.

VOY.name: Investigations
VOY.summary: Lt. Paris leaves Voyager to travel with a Talaxian convoy claiming to not fit in with Voyagers crew. Neelix later suspects Lt. Paris of being a traitor to Voyager when he decides to become a investigative video journalist.

VOY.name: Deadlock
VOY.summary: After discovering Viidian ships, Voyager travels to a region of space that will disguise them from the ships sensors. A on-board disaster then occurs while Ensign Wildman is having her baby which causes problems for the Doctor.

VOY.name: Innocence
VOY.summary: After Tuvok crash lands on a moon that is considered sacred, he attempts to save three abandoned children from the messenger of death while repairing his shuttle.

VOY.name: The Thaw
VOY.summary: The crew of Voyager discovers a world with technology and no people. They then determine that the planets inhabitants are in hibernation in order to protect themselves from a natural disaster.

VOY.name: Tuvix
VOY.summary: Tuvok and Neelix are on a away mission and a transporter accident causes them to be combined into one person called Tuvix with the personality of both of them combined.

VOY.name: Resolutions
VOY.summary: After Captain Janeway and Chakotay contract a deadly virus, they are set down on a small planet so the rest of the crew will not become infected.

VOY.name: Basics, Part I
VOY.summary: Chakotay is told his son has been taken by the Kazons, during the process of trying to rescue him Voyager is taken by the Kazons after the crew looses the ship in a running battle with the Kazons.

VOY.name: Basics, Part II
VOY.summary: Captain Janeway and her crew battle the primitive planet they were dropped on while a rescue attempt originates from Voyager itself.

VOY.name: Flashback
VOY.summary: Mind melding with Tuvok causes Captain Janeway to relive her tour of duty with Capt. Sulu and Cmdr. Rand.

VOY.name: The Chute
VOY.summary: Lt. Paris and Ensign Kim are accused of being members of a terrorist group called 'Open Sky' and imprisoned; Nexis is asked to use his ship on a special mission to help them.

VOY.name: The Swarm
VOY.summary: Voyager's crew fights off alien vessels; a holodeck accident cause the Doctor's memory circuits to fail; Lt. Paris and Belana are injured.

VOY.name: False Profits
VOY.summary: Chakotay and Paris beam down to a planet and discover two Ferengi that are passing themselves off as demigods to the inhabitants of the planet in order to make a profit.

VOY.name: Remember
VOY.summary: Lt. Torres is haunted by dreams of a forbidden love affair when the crew of Voyager picks up several Enaran passengers.

VOY.name: Sacred Ground
VOY.summary: Kes is accidentally injured at a sacred shrine and Captain Janeway undergoes a arduous spiritual test in order to try and save her on the Nechani world.

VOY.name: Future's End, Part I
VOY.summary: Voyager accidentally travels back in time when they have a encounter with a ship from the future that wants to destroy them. They arrive in 1996 Los Angeles and attempt to help prevent a event that could drastically alter Earth's future in the 29th century.

VOY.name: Future's End, Part II
VOY.summary: Lt. Paris and Tuvok seek help in Los Angeles as Henry Starling takes Voyagers Doctor hostage and prepares to launch his stolen time ship.

VOY.name: Warlord
VOY.summary: A dying alien that the crew of Voyager has brought on board, transfers his mind into Kes and uses her body to execute a political coup on his own planet.

VOY.name: The Q and the Grey
VOY.summary: Q surprises Captain Janeway in her quarters with the announcement that he has chosen her to be the mother of his child to be. Janeway discovers that there is a civil war going on in the Q Continuum.

VOY.name: Macrocosm
VOY.summary: An alien macroviral lifeform seizes Voyager and the ship is disabled; The holographic doctor goes on his first mission.

VOY.name: Fair Trade
VOY.summary: Neelix meet's up with Wiiban, a fellow Telaxian who he used to work with in the past and is conned into using a Federation shuttlecraft to traffic in narcotics.

VOY.name: Alter Ego
VOY.summary: When Ensign Kim falls for a attractive Holodeck character, he seeks help from Tuvok in learning how to suppress his emotions.

VOY.name: Coda
VOY.summary: Captain Janeway is critically injured in a shuttle crash all the crew except for Kes thinks she is dead. Janeway has visions of her deceased father Admiral Janeway.

VOY.name: Blood Fever
VOY.summary: Torres has a unpleasant encounter with Vorick, a Vulcan crew member who is starting to go through Pon-Far. Torres then finds herself getting more and more out of control putting crew members in jeopardy.

VOY.name: Unity
VOY.summary: Commander Chakotay is attacked after answering a distress signal then is surprised by the people who sent the signal. Captain Janeway makes a scary discovery in nearby space.

VOY.name: The Darkling
VOY.summary: The Doctors attempt to enhance his personality backfires; Kes's encounter with alien visitors causes her to consider leaving Voyager.

VOY.name: Rise
VOY.summary: Voyager's crew is giving help to the Nezu's planet when they are being hit by asteroids. Tuvok and Neelix are trapped on the ground when they attempt to rescue a Nezu doctor who says he has information about the asteroids that are hitting the planet.

VOY.name: Favorite Son
VOY.summary: Ensign Kim leads Voyager to a strange planet where the almost all female population claims to recall his birth there on that planet.

VOY.name: Before and After
VOY.summary: A life-extension experimental treatment sends Kes out of temporal sync and she starts moving though the past and future.

VOY.name: Real Life
VOY.summary: Torres tries to make the Doctor's holographic son more realistic by making him listen to Klingon music.

VOY.name: Distant Origin
VOY.summary: Scientists of the Voth race discover the human remains of a Voyager crewman and locate a genetic pattern similar to their own.

VOY.name: Displaced
VOY.summary: One by one, Voyager's crew members are being replaced by strangers, and the replacements don't know why they are there.

VOY.name: Worst Case Scenario
VOY.summary: Members of the Voyager crew clandestinely participate in a hidden holodeck program where the ship's Maquis members stage an insurrection.

VOY.name: Scorpion, Part I
VOY.summary: About to enter Borg space, the Voyager crew discovers a threat so devastating that even the Borg cannot deal with it.

VOY.name: Scorpion, Part II
VOY.summary: Voyager finds a solution to combat the invader of Borg space. All Janeway asks is free passage through their territory and she'll share knowledge. Seven of Nine is assigned to work with Janeway and the Voyager crew.

VOY.name: The Gift
VOY.summary: Kes's telepathic powers increase and she has to make a life changing decision. The Doctor starts to remove Seven of Nines Borg implants, even though she does not want him to, because of her body is starting to reject them.

VOY.name: Day of Honor
VOY.summary: Torres confesses her love to Paris when they are left for dead after Caatati attack their shuttlecraft.

VOY.name: Nemesis
VOY.summary: After Chakotay is marooned on a planet where two alien life forms are attempting genocide against each other, he starts to feel sympathy for the aliens who are helping him since he is not of their enemy race. Janeway and the command crew attempt to discover where Chakotay's shuttle crashed.

VOY.name: Revulsion
VOY.summary: The Doctor and Torres go on a away mission to a space station after receiving a distress call from a holographic crewman. Ensign Kim and Seven of Nine work with each other again and start to get to know each other.

VOY.name: The Raven
VOY.summary: Seven of Nine's Borg implants start regenerating after she starts having a series of hallucinations. She then escapes from Voyager into alien space and discovers a wrecked spaceship on one of the alien races worlds.

VOY.name: Scientific Method
VOY.summary: The Doctor and Seven of Nine discover that a mysterious illness striking down the crew is the work of aliens conducting genetic experiments on crew members.

VOY.name: Year of Hell, Part I
VOY.summary: A renegade Krenim warship with the ability to alter the time stream threatens the crew of Voyager as they pass through what has now become the Krenim empire.

VOY.name: Year of Hell, Part II
VOY.summary: Captain Janeway desperately tries to keep Voyager from being completely destroyed, Paris and Chakotay try to plot how to save Voyager while on the Krenim time ship.

VOY.name: Random Thoughts
VOY.summary: While Voyagers crew is on shore leave on a planet of telepaths and no crime, a savage beating preformed by one of the worlds citizens sparks an investigation of Lt. Torres. Tuvok makes friends with the worlds police officer and Neelix becomes interested in a female shop keeper.

VOY.name: Concerning Flight
VOY.summary: While on their journey home, Voyager is plundered by space pirates, Captain Janeway and Tuvok persue them to their homeworld, where the holodeck program of Leonardo Da Vinci helps Captain Janeway.

VOY.name: Mortal Coil
VOY.summary: After being killed on an away mission and then revived by Seven's Borg nanoprobes, Neelix finds himself in a deep existential and spiritual crisis, questioning his faith and the meaning of his existence,

VOY.name: Waking Moments
VOY.summary: The crew begins to experience vivid nightmares, all containing the same mysterious alien.

VOY.name: Message in a Bottle
VOY.summary: Seven of Nine finds an abandoned subspace relay network that has the ability to send a message, or in this case The Doctor, to a Starfleet ship detected in the Alpha Quadrant.

VOY.name: Hunters
VOY.summary: Voyager receives a message from Starfleet containing letters from the crew's friends and family.

VOY.name: Prey
VOY.summary: A member of species 8472 who is being pursued by a race of hunters, escapes to Voyager. Captain Janeway then puts the creature under her protection much to the chagrin of those who are hunting it.

VOY.name: Retrospect
VOY.summary: After working with a arms dealer, Seven of Nine starts having mental images of the arms dealer holding her captive and stealing Borg Nanobots from her. Captain Janeway starts a investigation into the matter with the help of the Doctor.

VOY.name: The Killing Game, Part I
VOY.summary: After taking over Voyager, the Hirogens us the holodeck to run a World War 2 simulation with the safety's removed and crew members as combatants.

VOY.name: The Killing Game, Part II
VOY.summary: Captain Janeway works with Seven of Nine and Harry Kim to shut down the Holodeck simulation that the Hirogen's have started and expanded while also trying to restore the rest of the crews identities.

VOY.name: Vis à Vis
VOY.summary: A genome thief switches physical forms with Tom Paris.

VOY.name: The Omega Directive
VOY.summary: Captain Janeway must carry out a top secret Starfleet directive regarding the most powerful substance known to exist.

VOY.name: Unforgettable
VOY.summary: Chakotay meets a woman who claims that they fell in love a few weeks before, although he doesn't remember her anymore.

VOY.name: Living Witness
VOY.summary: Reactivated after lying inactive for seven hundred years, a backup version of The Doctor tries to uncover the truth about war crimes supposedly committed by Voyager when they passed a planet centuries ago.

VOY.name: Demon
VOY.summary: Voyager, desperately low on fuel, finds deuterium on a highly hostile "Demon class" planet.

VOY.name: One
VOY.summary: After the rest of the crew is placed in suspended animation to protect them from dangerous radiation, Seven, with only the Doctor for company, is placed in control of the ship.

VOY.name: Hope and Fear
VOY.summary: Finally decoding the message from Starfleet they received months earlier,Voyager is directed to a nearby sector where an unmanned Federation starship waits for them. However, everything is not what it seems when alien technology is found aboard the new ship.

VOY.name: Night
VOY.summary: The crew deals with extended travel through a desolate section of space. There they encounter two mysterious alien races who may be at war with each other.

VOY.name: Drone
VOY.summary: During a away mission, a transporter accident causes the Doctor's mobile emitter to become infused with some of Seven Of Nines nanoprobes. This causes a drone hybrid with 25th century technology to be created. Captain Janeway has to decide how to deal with a potential danger to all non-borg life.

VOY.name: Extreme Risk
VOY.summary: Torres erratic behavior over several months comes to a peak and begins to alarm her crew mates; Paris puts the finishing touches on the Delta Flyer, a vessel with both Borg and Starfleet technologies in order to retrieve a Starfleet drone from the gravity well of a large planet before aliens do.

VOY.name: In the Flesh
VOY.summary: Voyager's crew discovers that species 8472 has created a exact replica of Starfleet headquarters as part of their plan to invade the Earth.

VOY.name: Once Upon a Time
VOY.summary: Neelix tries to amuse a little girl with a holonovel about a forest creature called Flotter. Meanwhile, Naomi's mother is in trouble with the rest of the shuttle crew and Neelix is afraid to tell her about it in an attempt to protect her feelings.

VOY.name: Timeless
VOY.summary: A failed attempt to return home results in Voyager crash-landing on an ice world and also in the deaths of the crew, except Chakotay and Harry Kim. Now, fifteen years later, the two men, having resigned from Starfleet, attempt to alter history to save the ship from disaster before Starfleet can stop them.

VOY.name: Infinite Regress
VOY.summary: A piece of Borg technology that is discovered in a wrecked Borg cube causes Seven of Nine to display several assimilated personalities.

VOY.name: Nothing Human
VOY.summary: A dying alien organism latches on to Torres and the ships holographic Doctor uses a Cardassian Holographic doctor, who has had experience with alien physiology's, to save her life.

VOY.name: Thirty Days
VOY.summary: The crew of Voyager discover a strange ocean world in space and offer to help the inhabitants discover why the ocean is loosing water. Paris tells the story of the episode from the ships brig to his father as a effort to pass the time. When the world is discovered, Paris interrupts Kim in the middle of his Chaotica holodeck adventure.

VOY.name: Counterpoint
VOY.summary: Alien refugees are picked up by Voyager and hidden from a squadon intent on finding and capturing the defectors. The alien commander boards and inspects the ship numerous times during their passage through that area of space.

VOY.name: Latent Image
VOY.summary: When The Doctor discovers evidence that his memory files may have been tampered with, it sets in motion a chain of events that lead to the recollection of the death of a crew member, one The Doctor believes he was responsible for.

VOY.name: Bride of Chaotica!
VOY.summary: A holographic novel of a old earth chapter play is mistaken by aliens from another dimension to be a threat to them. Voyagers controls are taken off-line and Captain Janeway has to go into the holodeck as one of the story's characters in order to help stop the aliens.

VOY.name: Gravity
VOY.summary: Tom Paris, Tuvok, and The Doctor's shuttle crashes on a deserted planet within a temporally-distorted area of space, stranding the two with an alien woman who falls in love with Tuvok.

VOY.name: Bliss
VOY.summary: Voyager finds a wormhole that leads directly back to Earth, but Seven of Nine suspects that it may not be what it appears.

VOY.name: Dark Frontier, Part I
VOY.summary: Janeway decides to try and take Borg propulsion technology after encountering a borg scout vessel. Once they encounter their target, Seven of Nine's loyalty becomes divided between the Borg and Voyager.

VOY.name: Dark Frontier, Part II
VOY.summary: After Seven of Nine is lost to the Borg Collective, the Borg Queen attempts to put her to work helping the Borg. Janeway has to come up with a rescue plan to save her.

VOY.name: The Disease
VOY.summary: Ensign Kim breaks Starfleet medical rules involving contact with unknown alien races by having a interspecies relationship. Putting Voyager in possible medical jeopardy.

VOY.name: Course: Oblivion
VOY.summary: As Voyager crew members begin dying, they make a startling discovery about their true identities.

VOY.name: The Fight
VOY.summary: When Voyager is caught in "chaotic space," an area where the laws of physics are in a state of flux, Chakotay begins hearing and seeing things, apparently caused by the aliens living inside it who are trying to contact the ship.

VOY.name: Think Tank
VOY.summary: A group of extremely intelligent aliens offers to help Voyager escape from a race of bounty hunters known as the Hazari, in exchange for Seven of Nine.

VOY.name: Juggernaut
VOY.summary: Voyager encounters a Malon cargo ship that is adrift and in danger of releasing deadly theta radiation into that sector of space. Captain Janeway sends an away team to help stop the radiation spread.

VOY.name: Someone to Watch Over Me
VOY.summary: The Doctor starts teaching Seven Of Nine about human behavior and how humans interact with each other while on a date. During the lessons, the Doctor learns a little bit about his own possible humanity. Meanwhile, Neelix guides an ambassador through the ship and unwittingly creates a potential embarrassing situation for him.
Captain Janeway recalls a 21st century ancestor who was involved with the creation of a seminal self-contained biosphere called the Millennium Gate.

VOY.name: Relativity
VOY.summary: Seven of Nine is recruited by a star ship from the 29th century to save Voyager from being destroyed in the past.

VOY.name: Warhead
VOY.summary: While Kim is serving as commander of Voyager, a distress signal is discovered. When the away team goes to the planet in search of someone needing assistance a mysterious object with artificial intelligence is discovered.

VOY.name: Equinox, Part I
VOY.summary: Voyager finds another Federation star ship, the USS Equinox, stranded in the Delta Quadrant. But they also find that the Equinox crew is harboring a dark secret.

VOY.name: Equinox, Part II
VOY.summary: Captain Janeway takes her quest for revenge against Captain Ransom to extremes when she orders the use of photon torpedoes against the Equinox, tractors a neutral ship, nearly kills an Equinox crewman during an interrogation, and relieves Chakotay of duty when he questions her actions.

VOY.name: Survival Instinct
VOY.summary: Seven of Nine is stalked by three renegade Borg drones who want to learn from her how to terminate their neural links and become individuals again.

VOY.name: Barge of the Dead
VOY.summary: A near death experience while on board a shuttlecraft causes B'Elanna's consciousness to enter a Klingon netherworld where she encounters her mother.

VOY.name: Tinker, Tenor, Doctor, Spy
VOY.summary: The Doctor's experiments with a subroutine that allows him to experience daydreams puts him directly into the center of a crisis when he is monitored by scavenger aliens.

VOY.name: Alice
VOY.summary: A space shuttle with a female persona becomes an obsession for Tom Paris, and it convinces him to cannibalize Voyager's parts.

VOY.name: Riddles
VOY.summary: Tuvok is robbed of his mental prowess after being zapped by an energy force, and Janeway searches for the "shadow people" responsible for the attack.

VOY.name: Dragon's Teeth
VOY.summary: After escaping an armada attack, the Voyager crew finds a sleeping warrior race on a decimated planet.

VOY.name: One Small Step
VOY.summary: The crew searches for a 300-year-old U.S. spacecraft from the first manned mission to Mars that is trapped inside a massive ball of energy.

VOY.name: The Voyager Conspiracy
VOY.summary: Seven of Nine begins a new method of data analysis that makes her craft a conspiracy theory that Janeway and Tuvok intentionally stranded Voyager in the Delta Quadrant.

VOY.name: Pathfinder
VOY.summary: On Earth, the Starship Enterprise's Lt. Barclay becomes obsessed with contacting Voyager and turns to his old friend Counselor Troi for help.

VOY.name: Fair Haven
VOY.summary: A radioactive storm threatens the Voyager while the crew enjoys leisure time in the setting of Fair Haven, an Irish coastal village of the early 20th century.

VOY.name: Blink of an Eye
VOY.summary: Janeway and the crew orbit a primitive planet which begins to evolve at an astonishing rate, leveling its new-found weaponry at Voyager.

VOY.name: Virtuoso
VOY.summary: The Doctor becomes a celebrity among a race that has not developed music.

VOY.name: Memorial
VOY.summary: Janeway worries about crew members who are suffering from post-traumatic stress disorders after they return from an exploration.

VOY.name: Tsunkatse
VOY.summary: When Seven of Nine is captured by alien warriors, she is forced to fight a Pendari gladiator as a contestant in a deadly game.

VOY.name: Collective
VOY.summary: When Chakotay's shuttle is captured by a Borg ship, Janeway enters into hostage negotiations with a gang of dangerously erratic Borg children.

VOY.name: Spirit Folk
VOY.summary: Janeway visits Fair Haven, a holographic town, where residents suspect visitors of using black magic.

VOY.name: Ashes to Ashes
VOY.summary: The long-dead Ensign Ballard seeks sanctuary aboard Voyager, pursued by alien abductors who reproduce by reanimating cadavers.

VOY.name: Child's Play
VOY.summary: Seven suspects that Icheb's parents are not telling the truth about their son's assimilation; one of the Borg children still on board Voyager may hold the key to the mystery.

VOY.name: Good Shepherd
VOY.summary: An unexpected attack forces Janeway and three troubled crew members to work together in order to survive.

VOY.name: Live Fast and Prosper
VOY.summary: Con artists impersonate Janeway and her officers while pulling scams and marring Starfleet's reputation.

VOY.name: Muse
VOY.summary: A well-meaning alien poet uses B'Elanna Torres' Voyager stories as inspiration for his theatrical work.

VOY.name: Fury
VOY.summary: Kes returns to exact revenge on Capt. Janeway, betraying the ship to an alien life form that will absorb the crew's internal organs.

VOY.name: Life Line
VOY.summary: The Pathfinder Project makes use of a pulsar and the MIDAS Array allowing a data stream to reach Voyager, and Voyager to reply, every 32 days.

VOY.name: The Haunting of Deck Twelve
VOY.summary: Neelix tells the ship's children a ghost story about an electromagnetic life force that holds Voyager hostage while trying to make contact with Janeway.

VOY.name: Unimatrix Zero, Part I
VOY.summary: Janeway and Seven of Nine act to instill independent thought in the Borg Collective when an enclave of drones reaches a dream-fantasy state that weakens it.

VOY.name: Unimatrix Zero, Part II
VOY.summary: The Borg queen launches a full-scale attack against Voyager; Seven of Nine reunites with a former lover.

VOY.name: Imperfection
VOY.summary: To save an ailing Seven of Nine, Icheb secretly performs a dangerous procedure on himself and places his own life in jeopardy.

VOY.name: Drive
VOY.summary: When Paris enters the Delta Flyer in a race with Torres as his co-pilot, he learns that the Flyer is targeted for foul play.

VOY.name: Repression
VOY.summary: After members of the crew are discovered unconscious, Tuvok leads the search for the mysterious attacker who preys on those involved in the Maquis resistance movement.

VOY.name: Critical Care
VOY.summary: The Doctor must sidestep a tyrannical hospital administrator who kidnaps him and forces him to treat only privileged patients.

VOY.name: Inside Man
VOY.summary: When the Ferengi hijack Lt. Barclay's hologram and reprogram it, the Starfleet officer enlists the help of Counselor Deanna Troi to warn the Voyager crew.

VOY.name: Body and Soul
VOY.summary: When Seven of Nine harbors the Doctor's hologram inside her body, he revels in his newfound human sensations, especially an attraction to a female alien.

VOY.name: Nightingale
VOY.summary: Power goes to Harry Kim's head when he takes command as captain of a crippled alien ship under attack.

VOY.name: Flesh and Blood, Part I
VOY.summary: The Doctor shocks Janeway and the crew when he commits treason to help a group of rebel holograms escape subjugation by the Hirogen.

VOY.name: Flesh and Blood, Part II
VOY.summary: The Doctor commits treason to help a rebel band of holograms but becomes disillusioned when the leader abducts a Voyager crew member.

VOY.name: Shattered
VOY.summary: The ship splinters into a myriad of time zones, and only Chakotay can travel among the fragments of time to save Janeway and the crew.

VOY.name: Lineage
VOY.summary: A pregnant B'Elanna Torres is tormented by memories of an unhappy childhood as a human-Klingon youngster and the toll it took on her family.

VOY.name: Repentance
VOY.summary: Seven of Nine cries a river of shame over her actions as a Borg after she witnesses a once-violent alien criminal's intense guilt.

VOY.name: Prophecy
VOY.summary: A band of nomadic Klingons mistake B'Elanna's unborn child for their long-awaited messiah, and they resolve to follow the baby.

VOY.name: The Void
VOY.summary: Janeway forges an alliance among several hostile ships that have been preying on each other while trapped in a void.

VOY.name: Workforce, Part I
VOY.summary: The Voyager crew labors in a work camp on a distant planet, while the Doctor helms the ship and Janeway falls for a mystery man.

VOY.name: Workforce, Part II
VOY.summary: While the Doctor and Kim defend the ship, Chakotay must infiltrate the alien power plant and convince his abducted colleagues to return to Voyager.

VOY.name: Human Error
VOY.summary: Seven of Nine experiences the breadth of human emotions while researching relationships in a holodeck fantasy.

VOY.name: Q2
VOY.summary: Q2, Q's adolescent son, must receive a weeklong rehabilitation period at the hands of his reluctant aunt.

VOY.name: Author, Author
VOY.summary: The Voyager crew is in for an unpleasant surprise when the Doctor publishes a novel filled with characters based on his colleagues.

VOY.name: Friendship One
VOY.summary: Janeway must gain the trust of an alien society crippled by a nuclear device launched from Earth in 2067.

VOY.name: Natural Law
VOY.summary: Seven of Nine and Chakotay crash land on an isolated planet where they are surrounded by a primitive tribe of hunter-gatherers.

VOY.name: Homestead
VOY.summary: Neelix is reunited with his own species when he finds a settlement of Talaxians being oppressed by mercenaries on a mineral-rich asteroid.

VOY.name: Renaissance Man
VOY.summary: The Doctor impersonates several crew members to retrieve the ship's warp core and save Janeway's life.

VOY.name: Endgame, Part I
VOY.summary: A time traveler forces Janeway into a deadly showdown with her nemesis, the Borg Queen; a romance ignites during Voyager's peril.

VOY.name: Endgame, Part II
VOY.summary: A time traveler forces Capt. Janeway into a deadly showdown with her nemesis, the Borg Queen; a romance ignites during Voyager's peril.

DS9.name: Emissary, Part I
DS9.summary: In 2369, Cardassian forces finally withdraw from 70 years of Bajoran occupation -- on the edge of explored space, a new crew takes command of a former Cardassian space station and makes an incredible discovery that will change the galaxy.

DS9.name: Emissary, Part II
DS9.summary: In 2369, Cardassian forces finally withdraw from 70 years of Bajoran occupation -- on the edge of explored space, a new crew takes command of a former Cardassian space station and makes an incredible discovery that will change the galaxy.

DS9.name: Past Prologue
DS9.summary: A Bajoran terrorist tests Major Kira's loyalties to the Federation when he attempts to rid Bajor of the Federation for good.

DS9.name: A Man Alone
DS9.summary: Odo, the station's mysterious, gruff and yet incredibly fair shape-shifter Constable, falls under suspicion for a Bajoran's baffling murder -- and xenophobic hatred rears its ugly head in the station's rush to judgment.

DS9.name: Babel
DS9.summary: During refurbishment, Miles O'Brien unknowingly triggers a formerly dormant Bajoran underground booby trap that releases a potentially fatal virus throughout the station.

DS9.name: Captive Pursuit
DS9.summary: As visitors from the Gamma Quadrant start to arrive through the wormhole, Chief O'Brien befriends an unusual alien, Tosk, as hunters descend on the station searching for their humanoid prey

DS9.name: Q-Less
DS9.summary: Q arrives on DS9 fresh from exploring the Gamma Quadrant with archaeologist Vash. Soon afterwards, unexplained power fluctuations begin to plague the station, threatening to destroy it.

DS9.name: Dax
DS9.summary: New evidence reopens a thirty-year-old murder case and Jadzia Dax's previous host, Curzon, is the prime suspect.

DS9.name: The Passenger
DS9.summary: An alien criminal, attempting to prolong his life, hides his consciousness inside the mind of a station crew member.

DS9.name: Move Along Home
DS9.summary: After being swindled by Quark, the Wadi, a visiting delegation from the Gamma Quadrant turns four crew members into 'pieces' for a bizarre game.

DS9.name: The Nagus
DS9.summary: Grand Nagus Zek, the leader of the Ferengi Alliance, pays a surprise visit to lowly Quark's Bar to host a conference on exploiting the Gamma Quadrant -- and names Quark, not his own son, as his successor.

DS9.name: Vortex
DS9.summary: A fugitive from the Gamma Quadrant attempts to trade evidence about Odo's people for freedom.

DS9.name: Battle Lines
DS9.summary: A glimpse of the wormhole and Gamma Quadrant turns tragic, when a runabout carrying Kai Opaka, Sisko, Bashir, and Kira crashes on a planet of eternal war, where it is impossible for the combatants to die.

DS9.name: The Storyteller
DS9.summary: Chief O'Brien is appointed spiritual leader of a Bajoran village. Meanwhile, Nog and Jake try to help their new friend settle a struggle between two Bajoran villages.

DS9.name: Progress
DS9.summary: While overseeing an evacuation mission, Kira must try to persuade a stubborn old farmer to leave his home. Back on the station, Jake and Nog set out to turn an inordinate amount of seemingly worthless condiments into profit.

DS9.name: If Wishes Were Horses
DS9.summary: DS9 residents suddenly find their imaginations are manifested in physical form, and a spatial rift threatens to destroy the Bajoran system.

DS9.name: The Forsaken
DS9.summary: A visiting Lwaxana Troi becomes enamoured with Odo after he retrieves a stolen item of hers from a thief. Meanwhile, an alien computer program wreaks havoc with the station's systems.

DS9.name: Dramatis Personae
DS9.summary: Acting out roles both melodramatic and deadly, the DS9 command staff are infected by a viral historical incident archive from an alien culture within the Gamma Quadrant.

DS9.name: Duet
DS9.summary: After a Cardassian man arrives on the station suffering from an illness that he could only have contracted at a Bajoran labor camp during the Occupation, Major Kira leads an investigation to determine whether he is actually a notorious war criminal.

DS9.name: In the Hands of the Prophets
DS9.summary: Orthodox Bajorans voice objections to secular teachings about the wormhole in the station's school, causing violent tensions to erupt between DS9's crew and an increasingly popular fundamentalist faction of the Bajoran faith.

DS9.name: The Homecoming
DS9.summary: When Quark presents Major Kira with an earring belonging to a presumed dead Bajoran Resistance legend, she and Chief O'Brien journey to Cardassia IV in an attempt to free him from from a slave-labour colony. Meanwhile, an extremist Bajoran faction known as The Circle continues to agitate tensions on DS9 and Bajor.

DS9.name: The Circle
DS9.summary: When Kira is removed from her post aboard DS9, Vedek Bareil invites her to visit his monastery on Bajor to reflect on her next step. Meanwhile, Odo, Sisko, and Li Nalas attempt to discover who is the driving force behind The Circle when they begin arming themselves with weapons from a mysterious source.

DS9.name: The Siege
DS9.summary: As Federation citizens are evacuated from DS9, Sisko and a skeleton crew attempt to prevent The Circle and the Bajoran military forces under their control from occupying the station. Kira and Dax attempt to reach the Chamber of Ministers on Bajor with evidence of Cardassian involvement in the conflict.

DS9.name: Invasive Procedures
DS9.summary: When a violent plasma storm leads to the evacuation of the station, the remaining crew are overtaken by a group of mercenaries led by a timid Trill named Verad who has plans for Lieutenant Dax.

DS9.name: Cardassians
DS9.summary: Political tensions rise on DS9 when Bajorans board the station with a orphaned Cardassian whom they have adopted.

DS9.name: Melora
DS9.summary: Ensign Melora Pazlar, a new arrival on DS9 with a special gravity-based disability, finds an admirer in Bashir. Meanwhile, Quark receives a death threat from one of his former associates.

DS9.name: Rules of Acquisition
DS9.summary: Grand Nagus Zek assigns Quark to initiate negotiations with a planet in the Gamma Quadrant, the Nagus believes it will help the Ferengi Alliance get a profitable business foothold in new territory. However, the plan is put into jeopardy when Quark's new associate turns out to be more than he appears.

DS9.name: Necessary Evil
DS9.summary: After an attempt on Quark's life, Odo re-opens an unsolved five-year-old murder investigation in which Kira Nerys was originally a suspect.

DS9.name: Second Sight
DS9.summary: On the fourth anniversary of his wife's death at the massacre at Wolf 359, Sisko has an unexpected encounter with a mysterious woman visiting the station.

DS9.name: Sanctuary
DS9.summary: A group of refugees from the Gamma Quadrant travel through the wormhole in search of their fabled homeland, Kentanna.

DS9.name: Rivals
DS9.summary: Quark feels threatened when a charming con artist arrives on the station and opens up a competing bar and casino on the Promenade. Meanwhile, Chief O'Brien is determined to beat Doctor Bashir at racquetball.

DS9.name: The Alternate
DS9.summary: Dr. Mora Pol, the Bajoran scientist who studied Odo when he was first discovered, arrives on DS9 with evidence that he has found DNA signatures similar to Odo's on a planet in the Gamma Quadrant.

DS9.name: Armageddon Game
DS9.summary: Chief O'Brien and Dr. Bashir help the T'Lani and the Kelleruns eliminate their stockpiles of deadly biological weapons used in their centuries-long war. However, when both governments decide to make sure no technical knowledge of the weapons remains, O'Brien and Bashir must put their differences aside in the name of survival.

DS9.name: Whispers
DS9.summary: Upon returning from a mission to the Parada system, O'Brien begins to notice the crew acting strange around him and suspects there may be some unknown influence at work.

DS9.name: Paradise
DS9.summary: While surveying nearby star systems for M-Class planets, Sisko and O'Brien find themselves stranded on a previously unknown colony world where the colonists have adapted to life without advanced technology.

DS9.name: Shadowplay
DS9.summary: After discovering a colony in the Gamma Quadrant, Dax and Odo investigate the mysterious disappearance of several colonists. Back on the station Vedek Bareil visits Kira, and Jake gets a job with Chief O'Brien.

DS9.name: Playing God
DS9.summary: While hosting her first Trill initiate, Dax discovers a tiny, expanding protouniverse that threatens to destroy the entire Bajoran system.

DS9.name: Profit and Loss
DS9.summary: When a damaged Cardassian ship shows up near DS9, Quark is unexpectedly reunited with his lost Cardassian love, who is now a member of the Cardassian dissident movement.

DS9.name: Blood Oath
DS9.summary: Three legendary Klingon warriors reunite on DS9 seeking Curzon Dax, with whom they entered into a blood oath to one day exact revenge on their sworn enemy. Finding Jadzia to be as worthy a warrior as they felt Curzon to be, they invite her to join them on their crusade.

DS9.name: The Maquis, Part I
DS9.summary: When a Cardassian freighter, the Bok'Nor, explodes at DS9, the Cardassians blame Federation colonists in the newly established Demilitarized Zone. Meanwhile, Quark is approached by a Vulcan with an unusual business proposition.

DS9.name: The Maquis, Part II
DS9.summary: Under increasing pressure from Starfleet Command, Sisko tries to rescue Gul Dukat, stop the Maquis from escalating conflict within the Demilitarized Zone, and prevent an all-out war between Cardassia and the Federation.

DS9.name: The Wire
DS9.summary: When an addictive implant in Garak's brain begins to break down, causing the exiled Cardassian extreme pain, Dr. Bashir must convince a reluctant Garak to accept his help.

DS9.name: Crossover
DS9.summary: After suffering an accident whilst traveling through the wormhole, Kira and Dr. Bashir find themselves trapped in the mirror universe first encountered by James T. Kirk a century earlier.

DS9.name: The Collaborator
DS9.summary: The man most likely to take over as the new Bajoran Kai, Vedek Bareil, is accused of collaborating with the Cardassians during the Occupation.

DS9.name: Tribunal
DS9.summary: Chief O'Brien is arrested by the Cardassians for collaborating with the Marquis. However, on Cardassian justice is swift: the verdict is known before the trial even begins, and it's always guilty.

DS9.name: The Jem'Hadar
DS9.summary: On a camping trip in the Gamma Quadrant to conduct a planetary survey report, Sisko, Jake, Nog, and Quark encounter the ruthless soldiers of the mysterious Dominion, the Jem'Hadar.

DS9.name: The Search, Part I
DS9.summary: After their violent confrontation with the Jem'Hadar, Sisko takes an untested Starfleet ship, the Defiant, into the Gamma Quadrant in an attempt to make peaceful contact with the Founders of the Dominion.

DS9.name: The Search, Part II
DS9.summary: On his newly discovered homeworld, Odo learns to connect with his fellow Changelings. Back on DS9, Sisko grows concerned that the price the Federation is willing to pay for peace with the Dominion may be too high.

DS9.name: The House of Quark
DS9.summary: When Quark lies about killing a Klingon in his bar, he is pulled into a power struggle between rival Klingon families on Qo'noS and forced to marry the dead man's widow. Meanwhile, Chief O'Brien must confront the fact that Keiko gave up her career to join him on DS9.

DS9.name: Equilibrium
DS9.summary: When Jadzia begins experiencing violent mood swings and hallucinations, a disturbing secret from Dax's symbiont history reveals a much larger deception.

DS9.name: Second Skin
DS9.summary: As she travels to Bajor in search of answers about her past, Kira is abducted by Cardassians, surgically altered, and told she is the missing Obsidian Order deep-cover operative, Iliana Ghemor.

DS9.name: The Abandoned
DS9.summary: When a Jem'Hadar infant is found in salvaged spaceship wreckage from the Gamma Quadrant, Odo strives to teach the rapidly maturing soldier to think for himself.

DS9.name: Civil Defense
DS9.summary: Sisko, Jake, and O'Brien accidentally trigger an old Cardassian security system that believes DS9 has been taken over in a Bajoran workers' revolt and puts the entire station in lockdown.

DS9.name: Meridian
DS9.summary: On an exploration mission to the Gamma Quadrant, the Defiant encounters a unique planet that shifts between corporeal and non-corporeal dimensions. Back on DS9, Quark attempts to create a new holosuite program.

DS9.name: Defiant
DS9.summary: When William Riker from the Enterprise unexpectedly arrives on DS9 on vacation, he takes a liking to Kira, who has also been ordered to take some time off. However, when Kira gives Will a tour of the Defiant, it becomes clear that there's more to Will's vacation than meets the eye.

DS9.name: Fascination
DS9.summary: When Ambassador Lwaxana Troi and Keiko O'Brien return to DS9 for the Bajoran Gratitude Festival, residents of the station suddenly become uncontrollably infatuated with one another.

DS9.name: Past Tense, Part I
DS9.summary: After a transporter malfunction aboard the Defiant, Sisko, Bashir, and Dax find themselves thrown back three hundred years into Earth's dark past without any means of getting home.

DS9.name: Past Tense, Part II
DS9.summary: With history itself at stake, Sisko assumes the role of a pivotal historical figure in order to restore the timeline, even if it means sacrificing his own life.

DS9.name: Life Support
DS9.summary: After a serious accident aboard a Bajoran shuttle, Dr. Bashir struggles to save Vedek Bareil's life while Kai Winn concludes a peace treaty with Cardassia, putting his ethics to the ultimate test. Jake and Nog reluctantly explore the differences between Human and Ferengi cultures.

DS9.name: Heart of Stone
DS9.summary: Pursuing a Maquis raider to an unstable moon, Kira becomes trapped within an expanding crystal formation that threatens to engulf her. Meanwhile, Nog attempts to persuade a skeptical Commander Sisko to write him a letter of recommendation to join Starfleet Academy.

DS9.name: Destiny
DS9.summary: An ancient Bajoran prophecy complicates the first joint Bajoran, Cardassian, and Federation science mission: an attempt to establish a permanent communications link through the wormhole.

DS9.name: Prophet Motive
DS9.summary: When Grand Nagus Zek revises The Rules of Acquisition to be more philanthropic, Quark and Rom start to question whether their leader has gone insane. Meanwhile, when Dr. Bashir is nominated for a prestigious Federation medical award, his reaction is less than enthusiastic.

DS9.name: Visionary
DS9.summary: After receiving a minor dose of radiation poisoning, Chief O'Brien inexplicably begins experiencing a series of jumps into the future. Meanwhile, a Romulan delegation arrives on DS9 expecting an intelligence report on the Dominion in exchange for the continued use of the cloaking device aboard the Defiant.

DS9.name: Distant Voices
DS9.summary: After being assaulted by an alien thief in the infirmary, Dr. Bashir wakes to discover he has a dual mystery on his hands: what happened to the station while he was unconscious and why is he suddenly aging so rapidly?

DS9.name: Through the Looking Glass
DS9.summary: Smiley O'Brien from the mirror universe kidnaps Commander Sisko and convines him to impersonate his deceased, mirror universe self in order to persuade the alternate version of his dead wife, Jennifer Sisko, to join the Terran Rebels.

DS9.name: Improbable Cause
DS9.summary: When a bomb destroys Garak's tailor shop, Odo begins an investigation into who might want the exiled Cardassian killed and why.

DS9.name: The Die is Cast
DS9.summary: When the covertly assembled Romulan-Cardassian attack fleet enters the Gamma Quadrant on a mission of destruction, Garak is forced to interrogate Odo for information on the Founders. Meanwhile, Sisko goes against orders on a mission to rescue Odo.

DS9.name: Explorers
DS9.summary: An invigorated Sisko returns from Bajor and decides to build a replica of an eight hundred-year-old Bajoran lightship, hoping to use it to prove that ancient Bajoran explorers could have made it to Cardassia before developing warp drive.

DS9.name: Family Business
DS9.summary: When Quark's mother breaks Ferengi law by wearing clothes and earning profit, Quark and Rom are forced to return home to Ferenginar in order to convince her to confess and make restitution for her crimes. On DS9, Jake eagerly tries to matchmake his father with freighter captain, Kasidy Yates.

DS9.name: Shakaar
DS9.summary: When Kai Winn is appointed Bajoran First Minister, Kira becomes concerned about Winn's growing grip on power. However, when the Kai orders Kira to convince her old Resistance leader to return some farming equipment to the government, the situation rapidly descends into a vicious power struggle.

DS9.name: Facets
DS9.summary: While Jadzia performs the Trill zhian'tara ritual and meets with the previous Dax hosts, Nog undergoes his stress reaction test in preparation for entrance into Starfleet Academy.

DS9.name: The Adversary
DS9.summary: When a destabilizing coup takes places on the Tzenkethi homeworld, a newly promoted Captain Sisko is ordered to take the Defiant on a border patrol to evaluate the situation. However, soon after departing DS9 the Defiant develops a series of malfunctions, leading Sisko to consider that they may have a saboteur onboard.

DS9.name: The Way of the Warrior, Part I
DS9.summary: When a Klingon fleet under General Martok arrives at the station ostensibly to protect the Alpha Quadrant from the Dominion, Sisko recruits Lieutenant Commander Worf to investigate the Klingons' true intentions.

DS9.name: The Way of the Warrior, Part II
DS9.summary: Believing that the recent Cardasssian coup was orchestrated by the Dominion, the Klingon decision to attack Cardassia puts the Federation-Klingon alliance in jeopardy, and forces Worf to choose between his people and his oath to the Federation.

DS9.name: The Visitor
DS9.summary: When an aspiring writer turns up in the middle of the night, an elderly Jake Sisko recounts his life, which has become an endless quest to locate his father, after an accident in the engine room of the Defiant apparently claimed Benjamin Sisko's life.

DS9.name: Hippocratic Oath
DS9.summary: After crash landing on a planet, Dr. Bashir tries to help members of a rogue Jem'Hadar unit free themselves of their addiction to the drug the Founders use to control them. Meanwhile, Worf tries to adjust to life aboard DS9.

DS9.name: Indiscretion
DS9.summary: Major Kira and Gul Dukat form an uneasy alliance as they search for a missing Cardassian prison ship, the Ravinok, that disappeared six years earlier while carrying Bajoran prisoners.
